meanings.sent1: After the long break, she needed to reactivate her gym membership.
meanings.sent2: The IT technician will reactivate the computer system after the update.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reactivate the old toy, but it just wouldn't work.
meanings.sent4: The sunshine seemed to reactivate the sleepy flowers, making them bloom again.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was just what the team needed to reactivate their motivation.

meanings.definition: To restore to a state of activity or operation.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will reactivate the car's engine after fixing it.
meanings.sent2: The power outage caused the need to reactivate the building's emergency generator.
meanings.sent3: She had to reactivate her phone after accidentally turning it off.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped to reactivate the dried-up river, bringing life back to the area.
meanings.sent5: The reset button was pressed to reactivate the malfunctioning device.
